author: Special Correspondent
text:
With the model code of conduct in force in view of the ensuing Assembly election, licensed arms holders in Tiruchi and its neighbouring Perambalur and Pudukottai districts have complied with the directive by depositing their weapons with the police.

Although the exercise commenced before the election, it gained momentum once the Election Commission announced the poll date for Tamil Nadu recently.

Police sources said there had been 100 per cent compliance by licensed arms holders in the three districts who adhered to the directive and deposited their weapons either with the jurisdictional police station or in the armoury and submitting a certificate in this regard to the police.

The police had compiled a list of licensed arms holders and sent them a message asking them to deposit their weapons.

Police sources said over 540 licensed arms holders in the limits of Tiruchi Rural Police had deposited the weapons while the figure in Perambalur was a little over 80. Over 570 of them had deposited the weapons in Pudukottai district.

The weapons would be returned once the model code of conduct ceased to be in force.
title: Over 1,500 respond to advisory in three districts
